spatial_accuracy.notes: Overall layout resembles the plan (dining top-left, kitchen top area, bedroom left, stair zone bottom-right), but several key spatial mismatches exist. The dedicated entrance/foyer at the top-right with the double-door entry shown in 2D is not clearly present in the 3D (E1/E2). The right-side main room is labeled/treated as a different space (“Wash room”) rather than the Living Room and its boundaries/read are inconsistent with the 2D living room footprint (E2/E5). Kitchen geometry appears simplified to a near-rectangle and does not preserve the 2D plan’s wall offsets/notches and relationships to the entry zone (E4/E2). Internal circulation and the central core (wash/toilet) alignment appears shifted relative to the hall/living connection shown in 2D (E2).

structural_fidelity.notes: Adjacency is partially correct (bedroom near wash/toilet core; dining adjacent to kitchen zone), but the 2D entrance-to-living relationship and entry enclosure are not faithfully modeled (E1/E2). Several walls appear reinterpreted, producing different room boundaries (notably the right-side main room) (E2). Door integration is unclear/incomplete: the 2D shows a prominent double entry door and specific internal doors to bedroom/wash; the 3D does not convincingly match these placements/orientations (E2/E3). Potential hallucinated room labeling/function (“Wash room” as a large right-side space) not supported by the 2D (E5).

furniture_mapping.notes: Dining table/chairs and bed are present in roughly corresponding rooms, but the Living Room seating arrangement from 2D is missing/not mapped (E1). Furniture quantity/detail and scale cues are inconsistent (e.g., right-side main room largely empty vs. 2D living furniture) (E1/E4).

aesthetic_quality.notes: Isometric camera is acceptable and the model is readable. Lighting is flat and materials are minimal. Geometry is generally clean, but the presentation lacks clarity on doors/entry and fine architectural elements (door swings/frames) which reduces interpretability. Window slits are stylized and not clearly matched to the plan.

detected_errors.description: Missing/unclear dedicated top-right entrance/foyer area shown in 2D (“Entrance to the House”) including the prominent double-door entry.
Right-side main room does not match the 2D Living Room footprint/definition; circulation and boundaries read differently in 3D.
Hallucinated or incorrect room designation: large right-side space labeled/treated as “Wash room,” which is not a room in the 2D plan (wash area is a small central room).
Kitchen proportions/shape simplified in 3D; 2D plan shows more specific wall offsets/notches and a different relationship to the entrance zone.
Wash area + toilet core placement/alignment appears shifted relative to surrounding hall connections compared with the 2D plan.
Door placements/orientations do not clearly match the 2D (notably the entry double-door and internal doors to bedroom/wash/toilet).
Window placement is not verifiably consistent with the 2D plan; the 3D uses generic slit windows that do not clearly correspond to the plan’s window locations/lengths.
Missing Living Room furniture layout shown in 2D (sofa/chairs/side tables), reducing functional fidelity.
